ACOUSTICAL ENGINEERING INTERN CO-OP

From hospitals, to tech offices, to highways and everything in between, the infrastructure that surrounds us needs acoustical design. We're in the business of ensuring that sound and vibration gets due consideration so it doesn't cause disturbance or detract from the intended function of sensitive spaces.

BKL Consultants Ltd. (BKL) is currently seeking a co-op student who has a demonstrated interest in the field of acoustics. If you have taken some relevant courses in sound or vibration, or have relevant background or experience, we'd love to hear from you.

WHAT YOU'LL DO/DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Each employee at BKL works on multiple different architectural and/or environmental projects. As an acoustical engineering intern, you will be working under a number of different acoustical consultants throughout the internship and will be exposed to acoustical work in various industries and sectors.

We will provide the training necessary for you to carry out various duties but we will also expect the student to research some aspects of the job independently, with guidance from other team members.

In any given day may consist of the following work:


Programming and setting up noise or vibration monitoring systems in the field;

Carrying out exterior and interior noise calculations;

Preparing proposals, memos, letters, and reports for routine types of projects;

Refining systems for managing acoustical products, software, and instrumentation; and

Assisting other engineers making other types of sound and vibration measurements in the field.


Most work is expected to be office-based and at project sites in the Lower Mainland, but brief site visits to other locations in BC may be required.

CO-OP AT BKL
Want to know what your day might look like? Here's a blog about what it's like to be a co-op student at BKL.

ABOUT US
As British Columbia's premier acoustical consultancy since it opened its doors more than 50 years ago, BKL works with governments, facility owners, and consultants to provide accurate acoustics, noise, and vibration assessments and solutions. BKL's team of 17 acoustical engineers and scientists has more than 150 years of accumulated experience in acoustics. An extensive complement of specialized instrumentation and software supports the technical staff. Further details are provided on our web site at www.bkl.ca.

WHO YOU ARE/QUALIFICATIONS

An enthusiastic learner who takes pride and responsibility in their work

Good verbal and written communication skills

Enrolled in either engineering and/or science program

Already completed at least one or two co-op terms previously

Good computing skills, specifically proficiency in Excel

Quick learner - able to understand new programs quickly and to retain procedures necessary to utilize specialized instrumentation and computer software

Valid driver's licence
